title: How do literary terms contribute to a poems meaning? - Quora

response.answer_text: This question, sadly, is much too general. A “literary term” is a word or phrase describing a technique which a writer employs. When writing a poem, many literary techniques can be used, and we have names (terminology) we use for all of them. A literary term is the vocabulary, the words, we use to talk or write about what the writer did. Literary terms (the words) themselves are not generally used in poetry. Alliteration is used. Simile is used. Metaphor is used. All three of these are “literary terms.” For example, we don’t say, “How do medical terms contribute to a report’s meaning?” nor do we say “How do news terms contribute to a new’s article’s meaning?” The question should be more specific, referencing the term or terms (techniques/words) in question. Poets are very exacting…so should a question about poetry be.
